intro: Rondeletia stipularis, commonly known as the velvetleaf or red velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and clusters of small, showy red or orange flowers. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in moist forest understories. The flowers attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
